contentrichtext.text: {{For|the biographer|Kitty Kelley}} {{Infobox person |image= |birth_date={{Birth date|1902|04|27}} |birth_place=[[New York City, New York]] |death_date={{Death date and age|1968|09|29|1902|04|27}} |death_place=[[Hollywood, California]] |occupation=[[Theatre|Stage]], [[film]], [[television]] [[actress]]}} '''Kitty Kelly''', (born '''Sue O'Neil''' April 27, 1902 – June 29, 1968), was an [[United States|American]] stage and film character actress. She was best known as a member of the [[Ziegfeld Follies]] and her radio hosting with Columbia Broadcasting. One of her best remembered roles is that of Lt. Ethel Armstrong in the 1943 ''[[Paramount]]'' wartime drama ''[[So Proudly We Hail!]]''. However, she is probably more infamously remembered in the ''[[Hal Roach]]'' ''[[Our Gang]]'' comedy short ''[[Beginner's Luck]]'', which was released by ''[[M-G-M]]'' in 1935. In that film, Kelly was cast as the pushy stage mother of ''[[Spanky McFarland]]''. Thanks to his friends, she finds herself an unwitting victim, as well as a laughing stock, in the gang's attempt to sabotage and ruin Spanky's Shakespearean stage act in a talent competition. After the war, she appeared in many TV series (including ''[[Bonanza]]'', ''[[Alfred Hitchcock Presents]]'', ''[[Batman (TV series)|Batman]]'' and ''[[Perry Mason]]'', from which she made four guest appearances including the role of Millie Foster in the 1958 episode, "The Case of the Rolling Bones." ==Filmography== * 1925 : ''A Kiss in the Dark'' : Chorus Girl * 1930 : ''La Nuit'' (''La Nuit est à nous'') : Maud Sarazin * 1930 : ''Hot Bridge'' * 1931 : ''[[Behind Office Doors]]'' : Delores Kogan * 1931 : ''[[Bachelor Apartment]]'' : Miss Clark, First Girl in Ladies Room * 1931 : ''[[White Shoulders]]'' : Maria Fontaine * 1932 : ''[[Men of Chance (1932 film)|Men of Chance]]'' : Gertie Robbins * 1932 : ''Ladies of the Jury'' : Mayme Mixter * 1932 : ''[[Girl Crazy]]'' : Kate Foster * 1933 : ''The Girl in 419'' : Telephone Girl * 1933 : ''Too Much Harmony'' : Patsy Dugan * 1934 : ''All of Me'' : Lorraine * 1934 : ''A Woman's Man'' : Molly Evans * 1934 : ''The Lemon Drop Kid'' : Cora Jennings * 1935 : ''Beginner's Luck'' : Spanky's mother * 1935 : ''Dizzy Dames'' : La Vere * 1935 : ''The Farmer Takes a Wife'' : Ivy * 1935 : ''The Private Secretary'' * 1936 : ''[[Rhythm in the Air]]'' : Celia * 1936 : ''The Man Behind the Mask'' : Marian Weeks * 1937 : ''Blossoms on Broadway'' : Death Valley Cora Keane * 1938 : ''[[Men with Wings]]'' : Martha Ranson * 1939 : ''Grand Jury Secrets'' : Miss Clark * 1939 : ''Geronimo'' : Daisy Devine * 1939 : ''All Women Have Secrets'' : Mary * 1940 : ''[[Road to Singapore]]'' : Sailor's wife * 1940 : ''[[Women Without Names]]'' : Countess * 1940 : ''Those Were the Days!'' : Mrs. Sanford * 1941 : ''[[The Mad Doctor]]'' : Winnie * 1941 : ''Hold Back the Dawn'' : American Lady at Bullfight * 1942 : ''[[The Lady Is Willing]]'' : Nellie Quigg * 1942 : ''[[Larceny, Inc]]''. : Fourth customer * 1942 : ''[[They All Kissed the Bride]]'' : Spotter * 1942 : ''[[Holiday Inn]]'' : Drunk * 1942 : ''Lucky Jordan'' : Sara Maggotti * 1943 : ''[[So Proudly We Hail!]]'' : Lt. Ethel Armstrong * 1943 : ''Swing Out the Blues'' * 1944 : ''Practically Yours'' : Wife-newsreel theater * 1946 : ''[[Two Years Before the Mast (film)|Two Years Before the Mast]]'' * 1957 : ''Gunsight Ridge'' : Old Woman * 1958 : ''The Lost Missile'' : Mother Freed * 1960 : ''Twelve Hours to Kill'' : Woman ==References== {{refimprove|date=April 2011}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|0446580}} *{{IBDB name|47769}} <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> {{Persondata |NAME= Kelly, Kitty |ALTERNATIVE NAMES=O'Neil, Sue |SHORT DESCRIPTION=[[Theatre|Stage]], [[film]], [[television]] [[actress]] |DATE OF BIRTH=1902-4-27 |PLACE OF BIRTH=[[New York City, New York]], U.S. |DATE OF DEATH=1968-9-29 |PLACE OF DEATH=[[Hollywood, California]], U.S.}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kelly, Kitty}} [[Category:American musical theatre actresses]] [[Category:American film actresses]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:Actresses from New York]] [[Category:Cancer deaths in California]] [[Category:Ziegfeld girls]] [[Category:1902 births]] [[Category:1968 deaths]] [[Category:20th-century American actresses]] {{US-actor-stub}}
